definition: Lin Daiyu, female character in The Dream of Red Mansions, cousin and thwarted lover of Jia Baoyu 賈寶玉|贾宝玉
surname Lin/Japanese surname Hayashi
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
umber-black dye for painting the eyebrow
jade

sentences.english: She played the role of lin daiyu in a shaoxing adaptation of dream of the red chamber.
sentences.chinese: 她在紹興摺子戲中扮演紅樓夢的林黛玉。

sentences.english: She often heard from her mother that her grandmother’s home was very different from othes’.Recently she have seen several low-class maids who were dressed and dining surprisingly well.
sentences.chinese: 這林黛玉常聽得母親說過，他外祖母家與別家不同。

sentences.english: Lin Daiyu is my favorite character from the "Dream of the Red Mansion".
sentences.chinese: 林黛玉是《紅樓夢》中我最喜歡的角色。

sentences.english: So bad feeling to Jangmengjie who played Lindaiyu.
sentences.chinese: 對林黛玉的飾演者蔣夢捷感覺不好啊。

sentences.english: Li Shaohong, the director of the series, has yet to decide on the actress to play the role of grown-up Lin Daiyu.
sentences.chinese: 目前，導演李少紅還沒有確定由誰來出演成年林黛玉。

sentences.english: For example, Lin is sensitive; Xue Baochai is tough.
sentences.chinese: 林黛玉的敏感，薛寶釵的堅強。

sentences.english: Li Xu does the Dan why sudden refined language develop Lin Daiyu?
sentences.chinese: 李旭丹爲什麼突然辭演林黛玉？

sentences.english: Weak though in appearance, Lin Daiyu has a strong mind.
sentences.chinese: 林黛玉雖然看起來虛弱，內心卻很堅強。

sentences.english: Love should not be Lin Daiyu.
No wonder my mother said I like sentimental Lin daiyu.
sentences.chinese: 難怪媽媽說我像多愁善感的林黛玉。

definition: Jia Baoyu, male character in The Dream of Red Mansions, in love with his cousin Lin Daiyu 林黛玉 but obliged to marry Xue Baochai 薛寶釵|薛宝钗
Xue Baochai, female character in Dream of Red Mansions, married to Jia Baoyu 賈寶玉|贾宝玉
precious jade/treasures
A Dream of Red Mansions (first completed edition 1791) by Cao Xueqin 曹雪芹[Cao2 Xue3 qin2], one of the four great novels
Cao Xueqin (c. 1715-c. 1764), accepted author of A Dream of Red Mansions 紅樓夢|红楼梦[Hong2 lou2 Meng4]
Prospect Garden/Grand View Garden, a garden in Dream of the Red Chamber
Pan Jinlian (name lit. Golden Lotus), heroine of Ming dynasty vernacular novel Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus 金瓶梅
much sorrows and illness (idiom); melancholy and weakly
sequel/continuation of a book
Romance of the West Chamber by Wang Shifu 王實甫|王实甫[Wang2 Shi2 fu3]
Eileen Chang (1920-1995), famous Chinese-American novelist
Shen Fu (1763-c. 1810), Qing dynasty writer, author of Six Records of a Floating Life 浮生六記|浮生六记[Fu2 Sheng1 Liu4 Ji4]
servant girl/maid
Ximen Qing, character from 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2] and 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]

Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2] or Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Chiung Yao (1938-), Taiwanese writer
